problem.markdown:
>>What was the major flaw in the design of HP’s original system? <<
( ) Tool breakdown (x) Little room for inventory ( ) Low labor productivity
[Explanation] The breakdown of equipment in the system is inevitable and is a common source of variability in manufacturing. Low productivity was a result of idle machines. Insufficient inventory space was a flaw in the design. There was no labor in the line. (There was upstream and downstream of it.) Ultimately, little room for inventory meant that when a machine broke down, downstream and upstream machines would soon stop operating, and the machines would be starved or blocked and consequently idle. [Explanation]
